sentence.text: Novel targets ANTXR1 and positive regulation of Wnt signaling pathway were confirmed to be suppressed by miR-493 directly, and overexpression of ANTXR1 and RSPO2 could restore tumorigenesis in miR-493 treated phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation cell.

entity.text: positive regulation of Wnt signaling pathway

sentence.text: Hepatocellular carcinoma (phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation) is known as a highly prevalent cancer with a poor prognosis and short survival time, despite intensive research and clinical efforts.
These findings suggest that protein polyubiquitination-493 acts as a negative regulator in hepatocellular carcinoma progression and may be a potential therapeutic target for HCC

Moreover, Wnt/Î²-catenin signaling pathway, which was reported to be activated by actin cytoskeleton reorganization and RSPO2, was also inhibited by miR-493 overexpression and might be involved in anti-tumor function of miR-493.
